RT @chidi_akunna: 30. I pray you experience the power of His resurrection! #PressPray #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 29. Nothing can beat the power of His resurrection. #PressPray #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 28. Speak to those things that seem dead and watch them come back to life; speak to your marriage! #PressPray #iConnectHe…
RT @chidi_akunna: 27. As we mark the death and resurrection of our Lord, Jesus, believe that that which seems dead can rise again. #PressP…
RT @chidi_akunna: 26. Find faith and believe that that condition can turn around. #PressPray #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 25. Sometimes, people give up when they are so close to their breakthrough. #PressPray #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 24. You may have tried without results, but try again. #PressPray #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 23. You can have that sweet spouse back, you can enjoy your marriage again. #PressPray #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 22. I've seen wives who can nag like... become the sweethearts of their husbands,bringing him nothing but joy. #PressPra…
RT @chidi_akunna: 21. I have seen wife-beaters become so sweet and protective of their wives. #PressPray #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 20. I have seen spouses who deserted their homes return. #PressPray #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 19. I have seen some very difficult cases turn around to the wonder of everyone who knew about them. #PressPray #iConnec…
RT @chidi_akunna: 18. Before you discount what I am trying to say, can I encourage you to try praying about that situation? #PressPray #iCo…
RT @chidi_akunna: 17. Can I remind U that for reasons like this, God sent His son to die in exchange for our pain, hurt & sickness. #PressP…
RT @chidi_akunna: 16. Your 'strange' spouse can become your lover again. #PressPray #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 15. That marriage can bounce back. #PressPray #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 14. ...you may be overwhelmed at the moment, but I'd like you to know that there is hope! Yes, there is hope! #PressPray…
RT @chidi_akunna: 13. It doesn't matter how tough the situation might be, your marriage might be going through a trying phase;... #PressPra…
RT @chidi_akunna: 12b. ...she has decided to resign to fate and take things as they come. #PressPray #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 12. Having done all that was within her power to do with no tangible result,... #PressPray #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 11. Ken is against the idea of seeing a counsellor. #PressPray #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 10. She decided to see a counsellor and followed every suggestion religiously, but things did not improve. #PressPray #i…
RT @chidi_akunna: 9. "Will I ever enjoy my marriage again?"... More questions... #PressPray #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 8. "What happened to this good man? How did things get this bad?" These were some of the questions on her mind. #PressPra…
If two are better than one, then our spouses must do better, as married men/women, than they did as singles. #SupportHerDream

RT @chidi_akunna: 41. If you are struggling to let go of past hurt despite your best efforts, consider seeing a Therapist. #PastErrors #iCo…
RT @chidi_akunna: 40. True healing is an inside job! #PastErrors #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 39. Search within your heart to address any lingering issue that may trigger suspicion and fear! #PastErrors #iConnectHea…
RT @chidi_akunna: 38.There is Grace available if we are willing to open our hearts again,willing to let go so God can do the work. #PastErr…
RT @chidi_akunna: 37. Being willing to open your heart and let God know how you feel about the hurt is a good start. #PastErrors #iConnectH…
RT @chidi_akunna: 36. Truth is, there are things that are difficult to forgive, that's why we need the help of God. #PastErrors #iConnectHe…
RT @chidi_akunna: 35. Someone reading this might say, "she doesn't understand. If only she knows the pain and embarrassment". #PastErrors #…
RT @chidi_akunna: 34. At such times,it is needless for her husband to argue. Simply reassure her & do not take it to heart. Tough! #PastErr…
RT @chidi_akunna: 33. It is important to weigh the impact of our words before unleashing them. #PastErrors #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 32. Some women do not realise the extent of damage such emotional outbursts can cause. #PastErrors #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 31. ...yet she still refers to it, especially when she feels insecure about something. #PastErrors #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 30. E.g. U gave money to her friend in the past without consulting her because it was an emergency situation,... #PastErr…
RT @chidi_akunna: 29.I must state that there are times women make emotional statements,especially when they need some reassurance. #PastErr…
RT @chidi_akunna: 28b. Is that really the solution to staying loyal to you? #PastErrors #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 28. Yes, you simply enslave yourself when you try to check out what your spouse is up to each time. #PastErrors #iConnect…
RT @chidi_akunna: 27. Why the torturous suspicion? #PastErrors #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 25.If your spouse can't be vulnerable with U, then there is a level of intimacy U cannot experience as a couple. #PastErr…
RT @chidi_akunna: 24. In the words of @familyaffairs05, "there can be no intimacy without vulnerability." #PastErrors #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 23b. ...and in some cases, that has been like the molten magma in a volcanic eruption. #PastErrors #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 23. This is why some spouses would rather keep their errors to themselves ... #PastErrors #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 22. Actually, that would decide if he/she would open up to you again in the future. #PastErrors #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 21. Back to what triggered my line of thought, it is important how you react to your spouse's 'confession'. #PastErrors #…
RT @chidi_akunna: 20.Focusing on your spouse's past errors will keep you from enjoying a level of fulfilment in your relationship. #PastErr…
RT @chidi_akunna: 18. Nagging&constantly reminding him/her of the unmet expectation/obligation would not yield a positive result. #PastErro…
RT @chidi_akunna: 17. Whatever happened to unconditional love? #PastErrors #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 16. You leave your spouse feeling undeserving of love. He/she would have to keep trying hard to earn your love. #PastErro…
RT @chidi_akunna: 15. Giving up on your spouse or refusing to trust him/her again is not the right approach. #PastErrors #iConnectHearts
RT @chidi_akunna: 14. It might be that their spouses failed in the past or did not live up to a promise. #PastErrors #iConnectHearts
